intro: Calymella alpina, commonly known as the alpine calymella, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Europe. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its small, white or pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and it produces small, cylindrical fruits that contain the seeds. Calymella alpina is often found in alpine meadows and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
